benchmark_details.name: CS-Sum (Code-Switching Dialogue Summarization)
benchmark_details.overview: CS-Sum is the first benchmark for code-switching (CS) dialogue summarization across Mandarin-English (EN-ZH), Tamil-English (EN-TA), and Malay-English (EN-MS), consisting of 900-1300 human-annotated dialogues per language pair.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the comprehensibility of code-switching by large language models through dialogue summarization.

data.source: Human-annotated CS dialogue-summary pairs created by native speakers and synthetic data from existing English dialogue datasets.
data.annotation: Translated by native speakers from English dialogues to code-switched dialogues.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the comparison of generated summaries with reference summaries obtained from the original dialogues.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metric scores indicate better alignment with reference summaries.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated ten LLMs including open-source and proprietary models.
methodology.validation: In-depth error analysis and comparative evaluation of model performance.
